title: Jimmy_Carter
extract: James Earl Carter Jr. was an American politician who served as the 39th president of the United States from 1977 to 1981. A member of the Democratic Party, Carter previously served in the Georgia State Senate from 1963 to 1967 and as the 76th governor of Georgia from 1971 to 1975. He was the longest-lived president in U.S. history and the first to live to 100 years.
trendingreason: The Jimmy Carter article is trending on Wikipedia on December 30, 2024, likely due to the recent passing of the former president on December 29, 2024, at the age of 100, marking a significant moment in U.S. history as he was the longest-lived president in American history. His achievements and legacy as the 39th president are being revisited and discussed widely following his death, prompting increased interest and updates to his Wikipedia page.

title: Squid_Game_season_2
extract: The second season of the South Korean dystopian survival thriller horror television series Squid Game, marketed as Squid Game 2, was created by Korean writer and television producer Hwang Dong-hyuk. It was released on Netflix on December 26, 2024.
trendingreason: The article on "Squid Game Season 2" might be trending on Wikipedia as of December 30, 2024, due to the series' highly anticipated return following its release on December 26, 2024, which has generated significant buzz. title: Jeju_Air_Flight_2216
extract: Jeju Air Flight 2216 was a scheduled international passenger flight operated by Jeju Air from Suvarnabhumi Airport in Bangkok, Thailand, to Muan International Airport in Muan County, South Korea. On 29 December 2024, the Boeing 737-800 operating the flight belly landed long and overran the runway, crashing into a berm encasing a concrete wall that supported an instrument landing system array. The collision killed 179 occupants; two cabin crew, seated aft, survived with injuries.
trendingreason: The Jeju Air Flight 2216 article is likely trending on Wikipedia due to the tragic crash that occurred on December 29, 2024, which resulted in 179 fatalities, making it the deadliest aviation disaster in South Korea in decades. Additionally, the incident has drawn significant media attention as it marks the first fatal crash in Jeju Air's history and highlights ongoing concerns about aviation safety.

title: Nosferatu_(2024_film)
extract: Nosferatu is a 2024 American gothic horror film written and directed by Robert Eggers. It is a remake of the 1922 silent film Nosferatu, which was inspired by Bram Stoker's 1897 novel Dracula. The 2024 film stars Bill Skarsgård as the titular character, Nicholas Hoult and Lily-Rose Depp as the married Hutter couple, with Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Emma Corrin, Ralph Ineson, Simon McBurney and Willem Dafoe in the supporting roles.
trendingreason: The Nosferatu (2024 film) article is trending on Wikipedia likely due to its recent theatrical release on December 25, 2024, and the buzz surrounding its premiere in Berlin earlier that month, which generated significant critical acclaim. Additionally, the film's connection to iconic horror themes and talented cast, including Bill Skarsgård and Lily-Rose Depp, further contribute to heightened public interest.

title: Squid_Game
extract: Squid Game is a South Korean dystopian survival thriller television series created, written and directed by Hwang Dong-hyuk for Netflix. The series revolves around a secret contest where 456 players, all of whom are in deep financial hardship, risk their lives to play a series of deadly children's games for the chance to win a ₩45.6 billion prize. The series' title draws from ojingeo ("squid"), a Korean children's game. Lee Jung-jae leads an ensemble cast.
trendingreason: The Squid Game article is likely trending on Wikipedia on December 30, 2024, due to the recent release of Season 2 on December 26, which has reignited interest in the series and prompted discussions and analyses among fans and media outlets. Additionally, the series' significant cultural impact and anticipation surrounding new episodes contribute to the elevated engagement with its Wikipedia page.

title: Olivia_Hussey
extract: Olivia Hussey was a British actress. Her awards included a Golden Globe Award and a David di Donatello Award. The daughter of Argentine tango singer Osvaldo Ribó, Hussey was born in Buenos Aires but spent most of her early life in her mother's native England. She aspired to become an actress at a young age and studied drama for five years at Italia Conti Academy of Theatre Arts in London.
trendingreason: The Olivia Hussey article is likely trending on Wikipedia due to the recent death of the actress on December 27, 2024, at the age of 73. Hussey was celebrated for her iconic role as Juliet in Franco Zeffirelli's 1968 adaptation of "Romeo and Juliet," making her passing a significant moment in entertainment news and eliciting tributes and reflections on her career.

title: Pushpa_2:_The_Rule
extract: Pushpa 2: The Rule is a 2024 Indian Telugu-language action drama film directed by Sukumar and produced by Mythri Movie Makers, in association with Sukumar Writings. The film stars Allu Arjun in the titular role, alongside Rashmika Mandanna, Fahadh Faasil, Jagapathi Babu, Jagadeesh Prathap Bandari, Dhananjaya, Rao Ramesh, Sunil, Anasuya Bharadwaj and Ajay. It is the second instalment of the Pushpa film series and the sequel to Pushpa: The Rise (2021). The film follows Pushpa Raj, a coolie risen to the ranks of sandalwood smuggler, who begins to face tough opposition from enemies, including SP Bhanwar Singh Shekhawat IPS.
trendingreason: The article for *Pushpa 2: The Rule* is likely trending on Wikipedia due to its recent theatrical release on December 5, 2024, and it achieving significant box office success, grossing an estimated ₹1,719.5 crore within just 25 days. The film's popularity is further fueled by ongoing discussions surrounding its impact on the Indian cinema landscape and the prominence of lead actor Allu Arjun.

title: Jeju_Air
extract: Jeju Air Co., Ltd. is the first and the largest South Korean low-cost airline. Named after Jeju Island, the airline is headquartered in Jeju City with its largest base at Jeju International Airport. It is a founding member of the Value Alliance.
trendingreason: The Jeju Air article on Wikipedia might be trending on December 30, 2024, due to significant recent developments within the airline, including its innovative sustainability initiatives or financial performance recovery post-COVID-19, which could have garnered public interest and media coverage. Additionally, as a major low-cost carrier in South Korea, Jeju Air's operations and expansion could be under spotlight as travel demand continues to rebound after the pandemic.

title: 2025_PDC_World_Darts_Championship
extract: The 2025 PDC World Darts Championship is a professional darts event taking place at Alexandra Palace in London, England, from 15 December 2024 to 3 January 2025. It is the 32nd World Darts Championship to be organised by the Professional Darts Corporation.
trendingreason: The 2025 PDC World Darts Championship article is trending on Wikipedia as it is currently taking place, with matches running from December 15, 2024, to January 3, 2025, capturing the attention of darts fans and the gambling community due to its significant prize fund and ongoing live competition at an iconic venue. Additionally, the event's promotional campaign, which includes charitable initiatives and substantial bonuses for achieving nine-dart finishes, adds an element of excitement that resonates with both live viewers and participants.

title: Greg_Gumbel
extract: Greg Gumbel was an American television sportscaster. He was best known for his various assignments for CBS Sports. He became the first African-American announcer to call play-by-play of a major sports championship in the United States when he announced Super Bowl XXXV for the CBS network in 2001. Until 2023, Gumbel was the studio host for CBS' men's college basketball coverage and was a play-by-play broadcaster for the NFL on CBS.
trendingreason: The Greg Gumbel article is trending on Wikipedia due to the recent passing of the renowned sportscaster on December 27, 2024, at the age of 78. Gumbel was celebrated for his pioneering contributions to sports broadcasting, including being the first African-American announcer to call play-by-play for a major sports championship, which has sparked renewed interest in his legacy and career.
